member.name: T:Xceed.Document.NET.Alignment

member.summary: Align the Paragraph's text to the left.

member.summary: Align the Paragraph's text as centered.

member.summary: Align the Paragraph's text to the right.

member.name: F:Xceed.Document.NET.Alignment.both
member.summary: Align the Paragraph's text to both the left and right margins, adding extra space between the content as necessary.

member.name: F:Xceed.Document.NET.AutoFit.Contents
member.summary: Fits the columns? widths to their content.

member.summary: Stretches the table's width across the page.

member.name: F:Xceed.Document.NET.AutoFit.ColumnWidth
member.summary: The table does not have a fixed width and uses the defined column's width.

member.name: F:Xceed.Document.NET.AutoFit.Fixed
member.summary: The table has a fixed width and uses the defined column's width to calculate this width.

member.name: T:Xceed.Document.NET.MatchFormattingOptions
member.summary: Value indicating how formatting should be matched.

member.name: F:Xceed.Document.NET.MatchFormattingOptions.ExactMatch
member.summary: The formatting should be matched exactly. For example, a word in bold and italic will match if the other word is in bold and italic.

member.name: F:Xceed.Document.NET.MatchFormattingOptions.SubsetMatch
member.summary: The formatting can be matched partially. For example, a word that is in bold can be matched with another word that is in bold and italic because both words are in bold.

member.name: T:Xceed.Document.NET.MergingMode
member.summary: Value indicating the action to take when two documents are merged, and either they both contain a style with the same name but with different attributes, or they both contain headers/footers.

member.name: F:Xceed.Document.NET.MergingMode.Local
member.summary: The style and headers/footers from the local document are kept.

member.name: F:Xceed.Document.NET.MergingMode.Remote
member.summary: The style and headers/footers from the remote document are kept.

member.name: F:Xceed.Document.NET.MergingMode.Both
member.summary: The style from the local document is kept. The style of the remote document is given a new name and added to the merged document. The headers/footers from each document are kept when useSectionBreak is true, otherwise the headers/footers from the local document are kept.

member.summary: Value indicating the design/style to apply to a Table.

member.summary: The design named in the Table's CustomTableDesignName property will be used.

member.name: F:Xceed.Document.NET.TableDesign.None
member.summary: No design is applied.

member.name: T:Xceed.Document.NET.TableOfContentsSwitches
member.summary: Value indicating the Table of Content Switch to use.

member.name: F:Xceed.Document.NET.TableOfContentsSwitches.None
member.summary: No switch is specified.

member.name: F:Xceed.Document.NET.TableOfContentsSwitches.A
member.summary: Includes captioned items, but omits caption labels and numbers. The identifier designated by text in the specified value corresponds to the caption label.

member.name: F:Xceed.Document.NET.TableOfContentsSwitches.B
member.summary: Includes entries only from the portion of the document identified by the specified bookmark.

member.name: F:Xceed.Document.NET.TableOfContentsSwitches.C
member.summary: Includes figures, tables, charts, and other items that are numbered by a SEQ field.

member.name: F:Xceed.Document.NET.TableOfContentsSwitches.D
member.summary: When used with \s, the text in the specified value defines the separator between sequence and page numbers. By default, the separator is a hyphen (-).

member.name: F:Xceed.Document.NET.TableOfContentsSwitches.F
member.summary: Includes only those TC fields whose identifier exactly matches the specified value.

member.name: F:Xceed.Document.NET.TableOfContentsSwitches.H
member.summary: Makes the table of contents entries hyperlinks.

member.name: F:Xceed.Document.NET.TableOfContentsSwitches.L
member.summary: Includes TC fields that assign entries to one of the levels specified by text in the specified value.

member.name: F:Xceed.Document.NET.TableOfContentsSwitches.N
member.summary: Page numbers are omitted from all levels unless a range of entry levels is specified by text in the specified value. If no value is specified, omits page numbers from the table of contents.

member.name: F:Xceed.Document.NET.TableOfContentsSwitches.O
member.summary: Uses paragraphs formatted with all or the specified range of built-in heading styles.

member.name: F:Xceed.Document.NET.TableOfContentsSwitches.P
member.summary: Specifies a sequence of characters that separate an entry and its page number. By default, a tab with leader dots.

member.name: F:Xceed.Document.NET.TableOfContentsSwitches.S
member.summary: Adds a prefix to the page number for entries numbered with a SEQ field.

member.name: F:Xceed.Document.NET.TableOfContentsSwitches.T
member.summary: Uses paragraphs formatted with styles, indicated in the specified value, other than the built-in heading styles.

member.name: F:Xceed.Document.NET.TableOfContentsSwitches.U
member.summary: Uses the applied paragraph outline level.

member.name: F:Xceed.Document.NET.TableOfContentsSwitches.W
member.summary: Preserves tab entries within table entries.

member.name: F:Xceed.Document.NET.TableOfContentsSwitches.X
member.summary: Preserves newline characters within table entries.

member.name: F:Xceed.Document.NET.TableOfContentsSwitches.Z
member.summary: Hides tab leader and page numbers in web layout view.

member.name: T:Xceed.Document.NET.TableWrapStyle
member.summary: Value indicating the wrapping style used to wrap elements around a Table.

member.name: F:Xceed.Document.NET.TableWrapStyle.WrapNone
member.summary: No wrapping is applied.

member.name: F:Xceed.Document.NET.TableWrapStyle.WrapAround
member.summary: Text will be wrapped around the object.

member.name: T:Xceed.Document.NET.TabStopPositionLeader
member.summary: Value indicating the leader for a tab stop.

member.summary: Tick marks will be displayed outside of the chart.

member.name: T:Xceed.Document.NET.WrapStyle
member.summary: Value indicating how the text wraps around an object.

member.name: F:Xceed.Document.NET.WrapStyle.WrapInLineWithText
member.summary: The object acts like a character in a sentence. The line height will be affected by the object's size.

member.name: F:Xceed.Document.NET.WrapStyle.WrapTopAndBottom
member.summary: There will be no text on the right or left of the object. The text will appear at the top and at the bottom of the object.

member.name: F:Xceed.Document.NET.WrapStyle.WrapSquare
member.summary: The object is considered a square and the text will appear around that square.

member.name: F:Xceed.Document.NET.WrapStyle.WrapTight
member.summary: The text will appear around the object and inside a square object but will not enter the defined WrapPolygon.

member.name: F:Xceed.Document.NET.WrapStyle.WrapThrough
member.summary: The text will appear around the object and inside a square object but will not enter the defined WrapPolygon. Depending on the WrapPolygon size, text could appear inside the middle of the object.

member.name: F:Xceed.Document.NET.WrapStyle.WrapBehindText
member.summary: The object will be displayed behind the text.

member.name: F:Xceed.Document.NET.WrapStyle.WrapInFrontOfText
member.summary: The object will appear in front of the text.

member.name: T:Xceed.Document.NET.WrapText
member.summary: Value indicating the position of the wrapping text when using the WrapSquare, WrapTight or WrapThrough wrapping styles.

member.name: F:Xceed.Document.NET.WrapText.bothSides
member.summary: Text wraps on both sides of the object.

member.name: F:Xceed.Document.NET.WrapText.left
member.summary: Text wraps on the left side of the object.

member.name: F:Xceed.Document.NET.WrapText.right
member.summary: Text wraps on the right side of the object.

member.name: F:Xceed.Document.NET.WrapText.largest
member.summary: Text wraps around the largest side of the object; if the object is centered, then text wraps around the side on which text is first encountered.

member.name: P:Xceed.Document.NET.Chart.DistanceFromTextRight
member.summary: Gets/sets the distance of the text from the right of the chart. This property has no effect when the property WrappingStyle is set to WrapInLineWithText, WrapBehindText, WrapInFrontOfText and WrapTopAndBottom. The default value is 0.

member.name: P:Xceed.Document.NET.Chart.DistanceFromTextTop
member.summary: Gets/sets the distance of the text from the top of the chart. This property has no effect when the property WrappingStyle is set to WrapInLineWithText, WrapBehindText, WrapInFrontOfText, WrapTight and WrapThrough. The default value is 0.

summary.para: Gets/sets the horizontal alignment for the chart.

The chart can be positioned using the values Left, Right, Inside, Outside or Centered and can be relative to Margin, Page, Column, Character, LeftMargin, RightMargin, InsideMargin or OutsideMargin. The default setting is None.

member.name: P:Xceed.Document.NET.Chart.HorizontalOffset
member.summary: Gets/sets the horizontal offset of the chart in relation to the HorizontalOffsetAlignmentFrom property. Note that the HorizontalAlignment property needs to be set to None for this property to work. The default value is 0.

member.name: P:Xceed.Document.NET.Chart.HorizontalOffsetAlignmentFrom
member.summary: Gets/sets the horizontal offset alignment from either Margin, Page, Column, Character, LeftMargin, RightMargin, InsideMargin or OutsideMargin. The HorizontalOffset property value will be used as the offset value to calculate from. Note that the HorizontalAlignment property needs to be set to None for this to work. The default setting is None.

member.summary: Gets if the Axis exists in this Chart.

member.summary: Gets the Legend of this Chart.

member.summary: Gets the maximum number of Series in this Chart.

member.name: P:Xceed.Document.NET.Chart.Series
member.summary: Gets the collection of Series in this Chart.

member.name: P:Xceed.Document.NET.Chart.ValueAxis
member.summary: Gets the value axis of this Chart.

member.name: P:Xceed.Document.NET.Chart.VerticalAlignment
member.summary: Gets/sets the vertical alignment for the chart. The chart can be positioned using the values Top, Bottom, Inside, Outside or Centered and can be relative to Margin, Page, Line, TopMargin, BottomMargin, InsideMargin or OutsideMargin. The default setting is None.

member.name: P:Xceed.Document.NET.Chart.VerticalOffset
member.summary: Gets/sets the vertical offset of the chart in relation to the VerticalOffsetAlignmentFrom property. Note that the VerticalAlignment property needs to be set to None for this to work. The default value is 0.

member.name: P:Xceed.Document.NET.Chart.VerticalOffsetAlignmentFrom
member.summary: Gets/sets the vertical offset alignment from either Margin, Page, Paragraph, Line, TopMargin, BottomMargin, InsideMargin or OutsideMargin. The VerticalOffset property value will be used as the offset value to calculate from. Note that the VerticalAlignment property needs to be set to None for this to work. The default setting is None.

member.name: P:Xceed.Document.NET.Chart.View3D
member.summary: Gets or sets if this is a 3D Chart.

member.name: P:Xceed.Document.NET.Chart.WrapPolygon
member.summary: Gets/sets the list of points used to define the polygon inside the chart where no text can be drawn. This property will be used when the WrappingStyle property is set to WrapTight or WrapThrough. The top left of the chart has the (0,0) coordinate, while the bottom right has the (21600,21600) coordinate. Note that a minimum of 3 points are necessary in order to activate WrapPolygon. The default setting is null, but when the WrappingStyle property is set to WrapTight or WrapThrough, the default WrapPolygon will use the 4 corners of the chart for its points, meaning that there will be no text inside the chart.

member.name: P:Xceed.Document.NET.Chart.WrapStyle
member.summary:
Gets/sets the text wrapping style.
Available options are WrapInLineWithText, WrapTopAndBottom, WrapSquare, WrapTight, WrapThrough, WrapBehindText and WrapInFrontOfText. The default setting is WrapInLineWithText.

summary.para: Gets/sets the text wrapping positions when using the WrapSquare,WrapTight or WrapThrough styles.
Text can be positionned on both sides of the chart, on the left of the chart, on the right of the chart or on the largest side of the chart. The default setting is both sides.

member.name: P:Xceed.Document.NET.Chart.Xml
member.summary: Gets the XML for this Chart.

member.name: P:Xceed.Document.NET.ChartLegend.Overlay

member.name: M:Xceed.Document.NET.Document.InsertDocument(Xceed.Document.NET.Document,System.Boolean,System.Boolean,Xceed.Document.NET.MergingMode)
member.summary: Inserts the contents of another document at the end of this Document.
member.param: Represents the document to be inserted. This document will be inserted at the end of the base document.
If the value is true, the document is added at the end. If the value is false, the document is added at the beginning.
If the value is true,each joined document will be located in its own section. If the value is false, the joined documents will remain in the same section.
The action to take when merging two documents, and either two styles have the same name but with different attributes, or the resulting document needs to have headers/footers.

member.name: M:Xceed.Document.NET.Document.InsertDocument(Xceed.Document.NET.Document,Xceed.Document.NET.DocumentElement,System.Boolean,System.Boolean,Xceed.Document.NET.MergingMode)
member.param: Represents the document to be inserted. This document will be inserted at the given position in the base document.
Represents the position where the guest document will be inserted.
If the value is true, the guest document will be inserted after the basic position element. If the value is false, the document will be inserted before the basic position element.
If the value is true, each inserted document will be located in its own section. If the value is false, all documents will remain in the same section.
Represents the styles and attributes that will be applied to the final document once the guest document has been inserted.

member.name: P:Xceed.Document.NET.SignatureLine.DistanceFromTextBottom
member.summary:
Gets or sets the distance of the text from the bottom of the SignatureLine (in points). By default, 0.
This property has no effect when the SignatureLine's WrappingStyle property is set to WrapInLineWithText, WrapBehindText, WrapInFrontOfText, WrapTight and WrapThrough.

member.name: P:Xceed.Document.NET.SignatureLine.DistanceFromTextLeft
member.summary:
Gets or sets the distance of the text from the left of the SignatureLine (in points). By default, 0.
This property has no effect when the SignatureLine's WrappingStyle property is set to WrapInLineWithText, WrapBehindText, WrapInFrontOfText and WrapTopAndBottom.

member.name: P:Xceed.Document.NET.SignatureLine.DistanceFromTextRight
member.summary:
Gets or sets the distance of the text from the right of the SignatureLine (in points). By default, 0.
This property has no effect when the SignatureLine's WrappingStyle property is set to WrapInLineWithText, WrapBehindText, WrapInFrontOfText and WrapTopAndBottom.

member.name: P:Xceed.Document.NET.SignatureLine.DistanceFromTextTop
member.summary:
Gets or sets the distance of the text from the top of the SignatureLine (in points). By default, 0.
This property has no effect when the SignatureLine's WrappingStyle property is set to WrapInLineWithText, WrapBehindText, WrapInFrontOfText, WrapTight and WrapThrough.

member.name: P:Xceed.Document.NET.SignatureLine.HorizontalAlignment
member.summary:
Gets or sets the horizontal alignment for the SignatureLine. By default, None.
The SignatureLine can be positioned Left, Centered, Right, Inside or Outside, relative to Margin, Page, Column, Character, LeftMargin, RightMargin, InsideMargin or OutsideMargin.

member.name: P:Xceed.Document.NET.SignatureLine.HorizontalOffset
member.summary:
Gets or sets the horizontal offset (in points) of the SignatureLine in relation to the element identified in the HorizontalOffsetAlignmentFrom property. By default, 0.
The HorizontalAlignment property must be set to None.

member.name: P:Xceed.Document.NET.SignatureLine.HorizontalOffsetAlignmentFrom
member.summary:
Gets or sets the element from which the HorizontalOffset is calculated. By default, None.
The HorizontalAlignment property must be set to None.

member.name: P:Xceed.Document.NET.SignatureLine.Id
member.summary:
Gets the Id of the SignatureLine.
When creating a SignatureLine, an Id will automatically be generated; use this id in the SignOptions to associate a SignatureLine with a Digital Signature.

summary.para:
Gets or sets the instructions relative to this SignatureLine.
Used to inform the signer of the reason to sign this SignatureLine.

member.summary: Gets or sets the suggested signer of the SignatureLine.

member.name: P:Xceed.Document.NET.SignatureLine.SignerTitle
member.summary: Gets or sets the title of the suggested signer of the SignatureLine.

member.name: P:Xceed.Document.NET.SignatureLine.VerticalAlignment
member.summary:
Gets or sets the vertical alignment for the SignatureLine. By default, None.
The SignatureLine can be positioned at Top, Centered, Bottom, Inside or Outside, relative to Margin, Page, Line, TopMargin, BottomMargin, InsideMargin or OutsideMargin.

member.name: P:Xceed.Document.NET.SignatureLine.VerticalOffset
member.summary:
Gets or sets the vertical offset (in points) of the SignatureLine in relation to the element identified in the VerticalOffsetAlignmentFrom property. By default, 0.
The VerticalAlignment property must be set to None.

summary.para:
Gets or sets the element from which the VerticalOffset is calculated. By default, None.
The VerticalAlignment property must be set to None.

member.name: P:Xceed.Document.NET.SignatureLine.WrapPolygon
member.summary:
Gets or sets the list of points used to define the polygon inside the SignatureLine where no text can be drawn.
A minimum of 3 points are necessary in order to activate the WrapPolygon. By default, null (unless the SignatureLine's WrappingStyle property is set to WrapTight or WrapThrough, in which case it will contain the 4 corners of the picture by default, meaning no text inside the SignatureLine).
This property is used when the SignatureLine's WrappingStyle property is set to WrapTight or WrapThrough.
The top left of a SignatureLine has the coordinates (0,0), while the bottom right has the coordinates (21600,21600).

member.name: P:Xceed.Document.NET.SignatureLine.WrapStyle
member.summary: Gets or sets the text wrapping style. The default setting is WrapInLineWithText.

member.name: P:Xceed.Document.NET.SignatureLine.WrapTextPosition
member.summary: Gets or sets the text wrapping position. The default setting is bothSides.

summary.para: Gets or sets if the comments accompanying the SignatureLine will be displayed. Default is true.
